m_szDocTitle: Automakers start up Detroit | The Columbian
m_szDocSumamry: Automakers start up Detroit Minivans, flashy cars and displays take spotlight at show A worker builds a Ford display Thursday in preparation for this week's North American International Auto Show in Detroit. Ford, Fiat Chrysler, Aston Martin, Chevrolet will take part in the show, which opens to the public Saturday. (Paul Sancya/Associated Press) By DEE-ANN DURBIN, Associated Press Published: January 11, 2016, 5:50 AM A A DETROIT — That sound of engines revving? It’s coming from Detroit. The North American International Auto Show opens today in the “Motor City.” Automakers will debut around 45
